dialogues.Funeral: After the service we have complimentary lemonade in our wake room, but should you wish to upgrade to soda and sandwiches we can arrange that. People typically like to have a light bite after the service.        Excuse me, Mr. Forney, may I have a word? 101.  I hate to have to do this here, but there's a couple of things I need to discuss with you quickly, if that's  I know that we discussed your preferences for some aspects of today's service, including your choice of the cedar casket which the insurance company had covered. Unfortunately we were out of those and instead we've chosen a mahogany casket. Now there is an extra charge for the mahogany which I need to clear with you before we proceed. Is that  OK, great, thank you. If you could just sign here.  Just at the bottom there.  Just here, Mr. Forney, just under that... yes, that's great.  Now, just one other thing - we have another service following yours today, we hate to do this, but we're going to have to try to get through yours as quickly as possible. 102.  I don't want you to feel rushed, but we are really under the pump today and I just thought I should give you the heads up. Now, I notice, just looking at your order of service... (beat, thinking) Ah, look, let's play it by ear. We should be fine.  OK. Excuse me.  We are gathered here today to mourn the loss and commemorate the life of Madeleine Frances Forney.  Ah, if you could please take your seats as quickly as possible that'd be great. Thank you.  Madeleine was a beloved wife, mother, grandmother and friend. dialogues.Elsberry: Cerisola? Cimino? Cody? Cooper? Early? Edgerton? Fletcher? Forney. TJ Forney's back. Welcome back, TJ.  Folks? Fullwood? Greenberg? Herriman? Kelman? description: T.J., a high school freshman, lost his mother two months before in a car accident: his father pops pills and sits on the couch; his grandmother holds things together, chatting and cooking. T.J. wants the car back from the salvage yard where the owner's son is a bully. By happenstance, Hesher, a foul-mouthed squatter, moves in with T.J's family. T.J. also meets Nicole, a grocery clerk near poverty who helps him once. Hesher involves T.J. in crime, the bully is omnipresent, mom's car is slipping away, dad has checked out, T.J. watches Nicole at work, and his grandma invites him to join her morning walk: the odds are long that T.J. can assemble a family to help him thrive.â€”<jhailey@hotmail.com>
name: Hesher
